Interface Piece

All Known Implementing Classes:
Bishop, King, Knight, Pawn, Queen, Rook
public interface Piece

Defines the interface for classes that represents chess pieces

Method Summary
 int getColor()
          gets the color of this piece, either white or black
 javax.swing.ImageIcon getIcon()
          gets the icon of this piece, used to represent itself in the GUI
 java.lang.String getInitial()
          gets the initial of this piece, used in notation
 boolean moveIsValid(Coord c1, Coord c2)
          checks if the move from c1 to c2 satisfies chess rules or not
 void setBoard(ChessBoard cb)
          sets a chessboard reference
 boolean soFarSoGood(Coord c1, Coord c2)
          checks if the move from c1 to c2 is possible for the piece
 

Method Detail

soFarSoGood

boolean soFarSoGood(Coord c1,
                    Coord c2)
checks if the move from c1 to c2 is possible for the piece

Parameters:
c1 - starting coord
c2 - ending coord
Returns:
true if possible, otherwise false

moveIsValid

                    Coord c2)
checks if the move from c1 to c2 satisfies chess rules or not

Parameters:
c1 - starting coord
c2 - ending coord
Returns:
true if move is valid, otherwise false
